open_threads.notes: BA (distance/local college) continues intermittently; fees/attendance stress; admit cards kept carefully. On Jan 3 she pays the fee and submits/uploads the paperwork via Sharma Ji; acknowledgement printed (awaiting confirmation). On Jan 4 she tries checking status at Sharma Ji’s shop; the portal is slow on Sunday, so she prints an extra acknowledgement copy as backup; confirmation still pending. On Jan 5 she checks again and sees status: ‘Payment received. Application under review.’ She prints this status as proof. On Jan 14 (Makar Sankranti), she receives a portal update: ‘Approved’ with instruction to download a confirmation slip. On Jan 15 she downloads and prints two copies of the confirmation slip at Sharma Ji’s shop and files them in her plastic folder.

On Jan 11 Priya starts a ‘KEYBOARD’ fund after spotting a second-hand keyboard priced at ₹250. She reaches ₹250 on Jan 14. On Jan 15 she buys the second-hand USB keyboard for ₹250 and begins at-home practice (even without a screen), focusing on home-row anchor bumps and muscle memory. On Jan 16 she buys an OTG (on-the-go) adapter for ₹60 from Sharma Ji to connect the keyboard to her phone, enabling practice with visual feedback on-screen; she begins doing 15-minute at-home sessions using a typing practice site and starts sending typed messages (instead of voice notes) to Sana.

On Jan 5, noticing the F/J home-row bumps on Sharma Ji’s keyboard nudges Priya into asking how to learn typing. Sharma Ji offers to show her when the shop is empty; Priya plans short practice sessions (15 minutes, three days a week) as a step toward steadier work. On Jan 6 she completes her first 15-minute session focused on home-row drills (A-S-D-F / J-K-L-;) and keeps a printed practice sheet in her plastic folder. On Jan 7 she returns for Day 2 (15 minutes) and begins simple pattern drills (as/df and jk/kl); Sharma Ji scribbles the patterns on scrap paper for her to practice at home. On Jan 8 she completes Day 3 (15 minutes) despite a crowded Thursday shop; Sharma Ji has her type her name (‘Priya Verma’) and assigns a small home routine (name repetitions plus as/df and jk/kl patterns). On Jan 9, during a cold-wave school closure, Priya comes in just to practice and ends up typing a handwritten list cleanly for a customer; Sharma Ji pays her ₹50 and says he’ll call if more typing work comes. On Jan 10, under very dense fog warnings, Priya practises again (15 minutes) and types a Hindi complaint letter for an uncle for the electricity office; Sharma Ji pays her ₹60 and warns her to be careful with people’s names and words. On Jan 11 she sneaks in a short Sunday practice, asks about buying a keyboard for home practice, spots a second-hand keyboard for ₹250, and starts a small ‘KEYBOARD’ fund with ₹50. On Jan 12, Priya types a Vivekananda quote for Arjun’s National Youth Day chart and carefully types another Hindi list for a customer; Sharma Ji pays her ₹70. She adds it to her KEYBOARD fund, bringing it to ₹120. On Jan 13 she earns ₹50 typing a distribution list, taking the fund to ₹170. On Jan 14 (Makar Sankranti) she does a quick urgent job and earns ₹80, reaching ₹250—enough to buy the second-hand keyboard for home practice after the festival.
Income is uneven (tutoring/odd work). Wants more stability without leaving home abruptly.
Lucknow is close enough to matter; occasional trips for forms/exams/hospitals/errands.
Low-simmer family/community expectations; keep subtle and non-melodramatic.
